pr_title: Some block methods and param names

timeline.message: Some block methods and param names

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change COMMENT
    The rail block is ascending.
COMMENT
    The block in the direction of ascension does not have a top rim.
COMMENT
  • The rail block is ascending.
    • COMMENT
  • The block in the direction of ascension does not have a top rim.
html is evil indeed
timeline.author: liach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -5,6 +5,20 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_2241 net/minecraft/block/AbstractRailBlock METHOD (ZLnet/minecraft/class_4970$class_2251;)V ARG 1 allowCurves ARG 2 settings + METHOD method_24417 updateCurves (Lnet/minecraft/class_2680;Lnet/minecraft/class_1937;Lnet/minecraft/class_2338;Z)Lnet/minecraft/class_2680; + ARG 1 state + ARG 2 world + ARG 3 pos + ARG 4 notify + METHOD method_27935 shouldDropRail (Lnet/minecraft/class_2338;Lnet/minecraft/class_1937;Lnet/minecraft/class_2768;)Z + COMMENT Checks if this rail should be dropped. + COMMENT + COMMENT

This method will return true if: + COMMENT

    The rail block is ascending.
+ COMMENT
    The block in the direction of ascension does not have a top rim.

timeline.bodyText: Is this cycle or higher (next higher)? or just next (to me this looks like getting the higher difficulty)?
timeline.author: liach

replies.bodyText:
It seems to cycle as follows:
int newOrdinal = (oldOrdinal + 1) % Difficulty.values().length

So cycle probably make sense there
replies.author: i509VCB
liach

timeline.author: Juuxel
